intro: Pectinariella scroticalcar, commonly known as the sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. The species is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
